                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Gain on asset and investment sales, included in <i>Gain on asset and investment sales, net</i>, primarily represents gains recognized on the sale of the investment in MARA, the disposal
                      of trucks at Boddington and the sale of a royalty at NGM, partially offset by the loss recognized on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment for the year ended 2022. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(9)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Settlement costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents a legal settlement and a voluntary contribution made to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(10)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, net, included in Other expense, net, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model changes
                      implemented by the Company. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(11)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> COVID-19 specific costs, included in Other expense, net, represents amounts distributed from the Newmont Global Community Fund to help host communities, governments and employees combat
                      the COVID-19 pandemic. Adjusted net income (loss) has not been adjusted for $2 and $35, respectively, of incremental COVID-19 costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic at our
                      operational sites. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(12)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Primarily represents for the year ended, an $11 reimbursement of certain historical Goldcorp operational expenses related to a legacy project that reached commercial production in the
                      second quarter of 2022 and $7 of penalty income from an energy vendor early terminating a contract in 2022, included <i>Other income (loss), net</i>. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(13)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> The tax effect of adjustments, included in Income and mining tax benefit (expense), represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (4) through (12), as described above, and are
                      calculated using the applicable regional tax rate. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(14)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, net, included in Income and mining tax benefit (expense), is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, alternative minimum tax
                      credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three months and the year ended December 31,
                      2022, reflects the net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $178 and $246, respectively, the expiration of U.S. foreign
                      tax credit carryovers of $31 and $31, respectively, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $(38) and $(86), respectively, net removal to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $5
                      and $(8), respectively, a tax settlement in Mexico of $&#8212; and $(125), respectively, and other tax adjustments of $23 and $24, respectively. Total amount is presented net of income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests of $199
                      and $82, respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>

                  </td>

                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(3)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Reclamation and remediation charges, net, included in <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>, represent revisions to the reclamation and remediation plans and cost estimates at the Company&#8217;s
                      former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. Amounts are presented pre-tax net of income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests
                      of $(713) and $(713), respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(4)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Loss on assets held for sale, net, included in <i>Loss on assets held for sale</i>, represents the loss recognized due to the reclassification of the Conga mill assets as held for sale
                      during the third quarter of 2021. The assets were remeasured to fair value less costs to sell. Amounts are presented net of income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests of $&#8212; and $(199), respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                      NGM Lone Tree and South Arturo exchange, and gain on the sale of TMAC. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                      non-current marketable and other equity securities. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                  </td>
                </tr>

                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                      Notes and the 2023 Goldcorp Senior Notes. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(9)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Settlement costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily are comprised of a voluntary contribution made to the Republic of Suriname. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(10)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, net, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational or operating model
                      changes implemented by the Company. Amounts are presented net of income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests of $(1) and $(2), respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(11)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> COVID-19 specific costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, represents incremental direct costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19
                      pandemic and primarily include amounts distributed from the Newmont Global Community Fund to help host communities, governments and employees combat the COVID-19 pandemic. Adjusted net income (loss) has not been adjusted for $19 and
                      $82 of incremental COVID-19 costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic at our operational sites. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(12)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Pension settlements, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, represents pension settlement charges due to lump sum payments to participants. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(13)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Impairment of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents other-than-temporary impairment of other investments. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(14)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> The tax effect of adjustments, included in <i>Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, represents the tax effect of adjustments in footnotes (3) through (13), as described above, and
                      are calculated using the applicable regional tax rate. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(15)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, net, included in <i>Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</i>, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, alternative minimum tax
                      credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment is due the net increase or (decrease) to net
                      operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $204 and $419, respectively, the expiration of U.S. capital loss carryovers of $152 and $152, respectively, the
                      effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $10 and $(17), respectively, net reductions to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $78 and $99, respectively and other tax adjustments of
                      $23 and $5, respectively. Total amounts are presented net of income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests of $(253) and $(327), respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(16)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted net income (loss) has not been adjusted for $&#8212; and $8 of cash and $&#8212; and $3 of non-cash care and maintenance costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i> and <i>Depreciation
                        and amortization</i>, respectively, which primarily represent costs associated with certain sites being temporarily placed into care and maintenance in response to the COVID-19 pandemic during a portion of the three months and year
                      ended December 31, 2021, respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(17)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares, which are calculated in accordance with U.S. GAAP. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> <b><i>Earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation and amortization and Adjusted earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation and amortization</i></b> </p>
            <p> Management uses earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation and amortization (&#8220;EBITDA&#8221;) and EBITDA adjusted for non-core or certain items that have a disproportionate impact on our results for a particular period (&#8220;Adjusted EBITDA&#8221;) as
              non-GAAP measures to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance. EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA do not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, net income (loss), operating income (loss), or cash flow from operations as those
              terms are defined by GAAP, and do not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. Although Adjusted EBITDA and similar measures are frequently used as measures of operations and the ability to meet debt
              service requirements by other companies, our calculation of Adjusted EBITDA is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. The Company believes that Adjusted EBITDA provides useful information to
              investors and others in understanding and evaluating our operating results in the same manner as our management and Board of Directors. Management&#8217;s determination of the components of Adjusted EBITDA are evaluated periodically and based, in
              part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. <i>Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders</i> is reconciled to EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA as follows: </p>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

            </div>

                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(3)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Reclamation and remediation charges, included in <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>, represent revisions to the reclamation and remediation plans and cost estimates at the Company&#8217;s
                      former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(4)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Pension settlements, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents pension settlement charges related to the annuitization of certain defined benefit plans and lump
                      sum payments to participants in 2022 and related to lump sum payments to participants in 2021. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(5)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Change in fair value of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investments in current and
                      non-current marketable and other equity securities. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(6)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Gain on asset and investment sales, included in <i>Gain on asset and investment sales, net</i>, primarily represents gains recognized on the sale of the investment in MARA, the disposal
                      of trucks at Boddington and the sale of a royalty at NGM, partially offset by the loss recognized on the sale of the La Zanja equity method investment in 2022; and the gain on the sale of the Kalgoorlie Power business, gain on the NGM
                      Lone Tree and South Arturo exchange transaction, and gain on the sale of TMAC in 2021. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(7)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Settlement costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents a legal settlement and a voluntary contribution made to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine in 2022; and
                      a voluntary contribution made to the Republic of Suriname in 2021. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(8)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Restructuring and severance, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational and operating model
                      changes implemented by the Company for all periods presented. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(9)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> COVID-19 specific costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, primarily includes amounts distributed from Newmont Global Community Support Fund to help host communities, governments
                      and employees combat the COVID-19 pandemic. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(10)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Loss on assets held for sale, included in <i>Loss on assets held for sale</i>, represents the loss recognized due to the reclassification of the Conga mill assets as held for sale during
                      2021. The assets were remeasured to fair value less costs to sell. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(11)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Loss on debt extinguishment, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, primarily represents losses on the debt tender offer and subsequent extinguishment of the 2023 Newmont Senior
                      Notes and the 2023 Goldcorp Senior Notes during 2021. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(12)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Impairment of investments, included in <i>Other income (loss), net</i>, represents other-than-temporary impairment of other investments. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(13)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Primarily represents for the year ended, an $11 reimbursement of certain historical Goldcorp operational expenses related to a legacy project that reached commercial production in the
                      second quarter of 2022 and $7 of penalty income from an energy vendor early terminating a contract in 2022, included <i>Other income (loss), net</i>. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(14)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjusted EBITDA has not been adjusted for $&#8212;, $&#8212;, $&#8212;, and $8 of cash care and maintenance costs, included in <i>Other expense, net</i>, which primarily represent costs incurred
                      associated with certain mine sites being temporarily placed into care and maintenance in response to the COVID-19 pandemic for the three months and years ended December 31, 2022 and 2021, respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> The Company uses NGM EBITDA as a non-GAAP measure to evaluate the operating performance of its investment in Nevada Gold Mines (NGM). NGM EBITDA does not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, Income (loss) before income
              and mining tax and other items, as defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash distributions from NGM will match NGM EBITDA. Although the Company has the ability to exert significant influence and proportionally
              consolidates its 38.5% interest in NGM, it does not have direct control over the operations or resulting revenues and expenses of its investment in NGM. The Company believes that NGM EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others
              in understanding and evaluating the operating results of its investment in NGM, in the same manner as management and the Board of Directors. Income (loss) before income and mining tax and other items is reconciled to NGM EBITDA as follows: </p>
            <table cellspacing="0" id="zf14d15cd46f7448d8dac4f1602143f4a" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                  </td>

                    <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended <br>
                        December 31,</b> </p>
                  </td>

                </tr>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> <b><i>Free Cash Flow</i></b> </p>
            <p> Management uses Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations. Free Cash Flow is <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i> less <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities
                of discontinued operations</i> less <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> as presented on the Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. The Company believes Free Cash Flow is also useful as one of the bases for comparing
              the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows generated from operations by other companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Free Cash Flow is not
              necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. </p>
            <p> The presentation of non-GAAP Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to net income as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an alternative to cash flows from operating activities as a
              measure of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. The Company&#8217;s definition of Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual
              cash flows available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt service and other contractual obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company
              believes it is important to view Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. </p>
            <p> The following table sets forth a reconciliation of Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most directly
              comparable to Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</i> and <i>Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</i> </p>
            <table cellspacing="0" id="z22c2e764f6fd4d5ab0e113a96c7ae297" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities </i>includes<i> Additions to property, plant and mine development,</i> which is included in the Company&#8217;s computation of Free Cash
                      Flow.&#8203; </p>
                  </td>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> <b><i>Attributable Free Cash Flow</i></b> </p>
            <p> Management uses Attributable Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations that are attributable to the Company. Attributable Free Cash Flow is <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>
              after deducting net cash flows from operations attributable to noncontrolling interests less <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations</i> after deducting net cash flows from discontinued operations
              attributable to noncontrolling interests less <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> after deducting property, plant and mine development attributable to noncontrolling interests. The Company believes that Attributable Free
              Cash Flow is useful as one of the bases for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Attributable Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows generated from operations by other
              companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Attributable Free Cash Flow is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. </p>
            <p> The presentation of non-GAAP Attributable Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to Net income attributable to Newmont stockholders as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an alternative
              to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i> as a measure of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. The Company&#8217;s definition
              of Attributable Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual cash flows available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt service and other contractual
              obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company believes it is important to view Attributable Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Statements
              of Cash Flows. </p>
            <p> The following tables set forth a reconciliation of Attributable Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most
              directly comparable to Attributable Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding <i>Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</i> and <i>Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</i> </p>
            <table cellspacing="0" id="z3d0a4154ca524e129ec9690a31a6f20e" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Adjustment to eliminate a portion of <i>Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</i>,<i> Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations</i> and
                      <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development</i> attributable to noncontrolling interests, which primarily relates to Merian (25%) for the three months and year ended December 31, 2022 and Yanacocha (48.65%) and Merian (25%)
                      for the three months and year ended December 31, 2021. The Company acquired the remaining interest in Yanacocha in 2022, resulting in 100% ownership interest at December 31, 2022. </p>
                  </td>

                      basis. For the three months and year ended December 31, 2022, Merian had total consolidated <i>Additions to property, plant and mine development </i>of $19 and $56, respectively, on a cash basis. </p>

                      Flow.&#8203; </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>
            <p> <b><i>Net Debt</i></b> </p>
            <p> Management uses Net Debt to measure the Company&#8217;s liquidity and financial position. Net Debt is calculated as <i>Debt</i> and <i>Lease and other financing obligations</i> less <i>Cash and cash equivalents</i> and time deposits included
              in <i>Time deposits and other investments</i>, as presented on the Consolidated Balance Sheets. <i>Cash and cash equivalents </i>and time deposits are subtracted from <i>Debt</i> and <i>Lease and other financing obligations </i>as these
              are highly liquid, low-risk investments and could be used to reduce the Company's debt obligations. The Company believes the use of Net Debt allows investors and others to evaluate financial flexibility and strength of the Company's balance
              sheet. Net Debt is intended to provide additional information only and does not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of liquidity prepared in accordance
              with GAAP. Other companies may calculate this measure differently. </p>
            <p> The following table sets forth a reconciliation of Net Debt, a non-GAAP financial measure, to <i>Debt</i> and <i>Lease and other financing obligations</i>, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measures most directly
              comparable to Net Debt. </p>
            <table cellspacing="0" id="z565ff21598964c108ede1b55eecc73c8" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> <b><i>Costs applicable to sales per ounce/gold equivalent ounce</i></b> </p>
            <p> <i>Costs applicable to sales</i> per ounce/gold equivalent ounce are non-GAAP financial measures. These measures are calculated by dividing the costs applicable to sales of gold and other metals by gold ounces or gold equivalent ounces
              sold, respectively. These measures are calculated for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. We believe that these measures provide additional information to management, investors and others that aids in the understanding of the
              economics of our operations and performance compared to other producers and provides investors visibility into the direct and indirect costs related to production, excluding depreciation and amortization, on a per ounce/gold equivalent ounce
              basis. Costs applicable to sales per ounce/gold equivalent ounce statistics are intended to provide additional information only and do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a
              substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. The measures are not necessarily indicative of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures
              differently. </p>
            <p> The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measures. </p>
            <table cellspacing="0" id="z68ce0c4fca9a4117b69690a8f8d2aba0" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b><i>Costs applicable to sales per ounce</i></b> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;" colspan="5"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;" colspan="5"><br>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;" colspan="5"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;" colspan="5">&#160;</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> &#160; </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;border-bottom: solid black 1pt;padding-left: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;white-space: nowrap;" colspan="5">
                    <p style="text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <b>Three Months Ended <br>
                      </b><b>December 31,</b> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;text-align: center; list-style-position: inside;">

                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                  </td>

                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> See Note 3 to the Consolidated Financial Statements. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(2)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Excludes <i>Depreciation and amortization</i> and <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(3)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Per ounce measures may not recalculate due to rounding. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> <b><i>All-In Sustaining Costs</i></b> </p>
            <p> Current GAAP measures used in the mining industry, such as cost of goods sold, do not capture all of the expenditures incurred to discover, develop and sustain production. Therefore, Newmont calculates All-In Sustaining Costs (&#8220;AISC&#8221;) based
              on the definition published by the World Gold Council. The World Gold Council is a market development organization for the gold industry comprised of and funded by gold mining companies around the world and a regulatory organization. </p>
            <p> AISC is a metric that expands on GAAP measures, such as cost of goods sold, and non-GAAP measures, such as costs applicable to sales per ounce, to provide visibility into the economics of our mining operations related to expenditures,
              operating performance and the ability to generate cash flow from our continuing operations. We believe that AISC is a non-GAAP measure that provides additional information to management, investors and others that aids in the understanding of
              the economics of our operations and performance compared to other producers and provides investors visibility by better defining the total costs associated with production. </p>
            <p> AISC amounts are intended to provide additional information only and do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance
              with GAAP. The measures are not necessarily indicative of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently as a result of differences in the underlying accounting
              principles, policies applied and in accounting frameworks such as in IFRS, or by reflecting the benefit from selling non-gold metals as a reduction to AISC. Differences may also arise related to definitional differences of sustaining versus
              development (i.e. non-sustaining) activities based upon each company&#8217;s internal policies. </p>
            <p> The following disclosure provides information regarding the adjustments made in determining the All-In Sustaining Costs measure: </p>
            <p> <i>Costs applicable to sales</i>. Includes all direct and indirect costs related to current production incurred to execute the current mine plan. We exclude certain exceptional or unusual amounts from CAS, such as significant revisions to
              recovery amounts. CAS includes by-product credits from certain metals obtained during the process of extracting and processing the primary ore-body. CAS is accounted for on an accrual basis and excludes <i>Depreciation and amortization</i>
              and <i>Reclamation and remediation</i>, which is consistent with our presentation of CAS on the Consolidated Statements of Operations. In determining AISC, only the CAS associated with producing and selling an ounce of gold is included in
              the measure. Therefore, the amount of gold CAS included in AISC is derived from the CAS presented in the Company&#8217;s Consolidated Statements of Operations less the amount of CAS attributable to the production of other metals. The other metals'
              CAS at those mine sites is disclosed in Note 3 of the Consolidated Financial Statements. The allocation of CAS between gold and other metals is based upon the relative sales value of gold and other metals produced during the period. </p>
            <p> <i>Reclamation costs</i>. Includes accretion expense related to reclamation liabilities and the amortization of the related ARC for the Company&#8217;s operating properties. Accretion related to the reclamation liabilities and the amortization
              of the ARC assets for reclamation does not reflect annual cash outflows but are calculated in accordance with GAAP. The accretion and amortization reflect the periodic costs of reclamation associated with current production and are therefore
              included in the measure. The allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals. </p>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> <i>Advanced projects, research and development and exploration</i>. Includes incurred expenses related to projects that are designed to sustain current production and exploration. We note that as current resources are depleted, exploration
              and advanced projects are necessary for us to replace the depleting reserves or enhance the recovery and processing of the current reserves to sustain production at existing operations. As these costs relate to sustaining our production, and
              are considered a continuing cost of a mining company, these costs are included in the AISC measure. These costs are derived from the <i>Advanced projects, research and development</i> and <i>Exploration</i> amounts presented in the
              Consolidated Statements of Operations less incurred expenses related to the development of new operations, or related to major projects at existing operations where these projects will materially benefit the operation in the future. The
              allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals. We also allocate these costs incurred at the Other North America, Other Australia and
              Corporate and Other locations using the proportion of CAS between gold and other metals. </p>
            <p> <i>General and administrative</i>. Includes costs related to administrative tasks not directly related to current production, but rather related to supporting our corporate structure and fulfilling our obligations to operate as a public
              company. Including these expenses in the AISC metric provides visibility of the impact that general and administrative activities have on current operations and profitability on a per ounce basis. We allocate these costs to gold and other
              metals at the Other North America, Other Australia and Corporate and Other locations using the proportion of CAS between gold and other metals. </p>
            <p> <i>Other expense, net</i>. For <i>Other expense, net </i>we include care and maintenance costs relating to direct operating costs incurred at the mine sites during the period that these sites were temporarily placed into care and
              maintenance in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and exclude certain exceptional or unusual expenses, such as restructuring, as these are not indicative to sustaining our current operations. Furthermore, this adjustment to <i>Other expense,
                net</i> is also consistent with the nature of the adjustments made to <i>Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders</i> as disclosed in the Company&#8217;s non-GAAP financial measure Adjusted net income (loss). The allocation of
              these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals. </p>
            <p> <i>Treatment and refining costs</i>. Includes costs paid to smelters for treatment and refining of our concentrates to produce the salable metal. These costs are presented net as a reduction of <i>Sales</i> on the Consolidated Statements
              of Operations. The allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals. </p>
            <p> <i>Sustaining capital and finance lease payments</i>. We determined sustaining capital and finance lease payments as those capital expenditures and finance lease payments that are necessary to maintain current production and execute the
              current mine plan. We determined development (i.e. non-sustaining) capital expenditures and finance lease payments to be those payments used to develop new operations or related to projects at existing operations where those projects will
              materially benefit the operation and are excluded from the calculation of AISC. The classification of sustaining and development capital projects and finance leases is based on a systematic review of our project portfolio in light of the
              nature of each project. Sustaining capital and finance lease payments are relevant to the AISC metric as these are needed to maintain the Company&#8217;s current operations and provide improved transparency related to our ability to finance these
              expenditures from current operations. The allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals. We also allocate these costs incurred at the
              Other North America, Other Australia and Corporate and Other locations using the proportion of CAS between gold and other metals. </p>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

            </div>

                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(4)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Reclamation costs include operating accretion and amortization of asset retirement costs of $19 and $19, respectively, and exclude accretion and reclamation and remediation adjustments at
                      former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value of $13 and $1,594, respectively. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(5)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>Advanced projects, research and development</i> and <i>Exploration</i> excludes development expenditures of $3 at CC&amp;V, $1 at Porcupine, $3 at Pe&#241;asquito, $2 at Other North
                      America, $4 at Yanacocha, $3 at Merian, $7 at Cerro Negro, $10 at Other South America, $4 at Tanami, $6 at Other Australia, $7 at Ahafo, $2 at Akyem, $5 at NGM and $3 at Corporate and Other, totaling $60 related to developing new
                      operations or major projects at existing operations where these projects will materially benefit the operation. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(6)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> <i>Other expense, net</i> includes incremental COVID-19 costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic at our operational sites of $4
                      for North America, $12 for South America, $2 for Australia, and $1 for Africa, totaling $19. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">

                      severance costs of $1. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

                      and excludes development capital expenditures, capitalized interest and the change in accrued capital totaling $180. Refer to Liquidity and Capital Resources within Part II, Item 7, Management's Discussion and Analysis for discussion
                      of major development projects. </p>
                  </td>

                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(11)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Per ounce measures may not recalculate due to rounding. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(12)</sup> </p>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto;"><br>
                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Gold equivalent ounces is calculated as pounds or ounces produced multiplied by the ratio of the other metals price to the gold price, using Gold ($1,200/oz.), Copper ($3.25/lb.), Silver
                      ($23.00/oz.), Lead ($0.95/lb.) and Zinc ($1.15/lb.) pricing for 2022. </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>

              amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, which are intended to be covered by the safe harbor created by such sections and other applicable laws. </p>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> <b><i>Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA ratio</i></b> </p>
            <p> Management uses net debt to Adjusted EBITDA as non-GAAP measures to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance, including our ability to generate earnings sufficient to service our debt. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA represents the ratio of
              the Company&#8217;s debt, net of cash and cash equivalents, to Adjusted EBITDA. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA does not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, net income (loss), operating income (loss), or cash flow from operations
              as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. Although Net Debt to Adjusted EBITDA and similar measures are frequently used as measures of operations and the
              ability to meet debt service requirements by other companies, our calculation of net debt to Adjusted EBITDA measure is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. The Company believes that net debt
              to Adjusted EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others in understanding and evaluating our operating results in the same manner as our management and Board of Directors. Management&#8217;s determination of the components of net debt
              to Adjusted EBITDA is evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders is reconciled to Adjusted EBITDA as follows:
            </p>
            <table cellspacing="0" id="zc52930622b2d483eba5c3227a7afb97b" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">

                <tr>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom;padding-left: 0px;">

                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1"><br>
                  </td>

                  </td>
                </tr>

            <p> <b><i>Net average realized price per ounce/ pound</i></b> </p>
            <p> Average realized price per ounce/ pound are non-GAAP financial measures. The measures are calculated by dividing the net consolidated gold, copper, silver, lead and zinc sales by the consolidated gold ounces, copper pounds, silver ounces,
              lead pounds and zinc pounds sold, respectively. These measures are calculated on a consistent basis for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. Average realized price per ounce/ pound statistics are intended to provide additional
              information only, do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. The measures are not necessarily indicative
              of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently. </p>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

            </div>
            <p> The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measure: </p>

                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="padding-left: 0px;padding-right: 0px;text-align: left;vertical-align: top;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;text-align: left;"> <sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller;">(1)</sup> </p>

                  </td>
                  <td colspan="1" rowspan="1" style="vertical-align: top;padding-left: 0px;">
                    <p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 0px;"> Per ounce/pound measures may not recalculate due to rounding.&#8203; </p>
                  </td>
                </tr>

            </table>
            <p> <b><i>Gold by-product metrics</i></b> </p>
            <p> Copper, silver, lead and zinc are by-products often obtained during the process of extracting and processing the primary ore-body. In our GAAP Consolidated Financial Statements, the value of these by-products is recorded as a credit to our
              CAS and the value of the primary ore is recorded as Sales. In certain instances, copper, silver, lead and zinc are co-products, or a significant resource in the primary ore-body, and the revenue is recorded as Sales in our GAAP Consolidated
              Financial Statements. </p>
            <p> Gold by-product metrics are non-GAAP financial measures that serve as a basis for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with certain competitors. As Newmont&#8217;s operations are primarily focused on gold production, &#8220;Gold by-product metrics&#8221; were
              developed to allow investors to view Sales, CAS per ounce and AISC per ounce calculations that classify all copper, silver, lead and zinc production as a by-product, even when copper, silver, lead or zinc is a significant resource in the
              primary ore-body. These metrics are calculated by subtracting copper, silver, lead and zinc sales recognized from Sales and including these amounts as offsets to CAS. </p>

            <div style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
              <div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
                <hr style="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; MARGIN: 4px 0px; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000"> </div>
            </div>
            <p> Gold by-product metrics are calculated on a consistent basis for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. These metrics are intended to provide supplemental information only, do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and
              should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently as a result of differences in the underlying accounting
              principles, policies applied and in accounting frameworks, such as in IFRS. </p>
            <p> The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measures: </p>
            <table cellspacing="0" id="z6334800dc0f34c84bc51ec6d04011868" style="margin-bottom: 10px;margin-left: 0px; margin-right: auto; font-size: 10pt;">
